title: Bring back punch to your parties with these fall inspired rum punches
text:
Estate Signature Punch Photo courtesy of Appleton Estate Jamaican Rum. used with permission View all 8 photos When was the last time you went to a party and there was a big punch bowl out for everyone to serve themselves from? Although punches aren't as widely served as they once were decades ago, punches are still a great way to serve many people at a party without spending a lot of money. By making punches that are not your usual sangria you can resurrect the idea of serving punches at get togethers and in turn it'll make you THE trendsetting host of your group!
For fall consider making some fall inspired rum punches using Appleton Estate Jamaican Rum . They’re easy to make ahead of time and allow hosts to enjoy their parties instead of getting stuck being a bartender to everyone all night. Here are three rum punch bowl recipes to try out, the Jamaican Negroni Punch created by Jon Gasparini of Rye on the Road, the Holiday Caribbean Bowl and the Estate Signature Punch both created by Willy Shine . Each of these punches make six servings. First up is the Jamaican Negroni Punch.
Jamaican Negroni Punch
Ingredients:
15 ounces Campari ®
10 ounces Appleton® Estate Signature Blend
7.5 ounces Cinzano® Rosso
10 ounces Grapefruit juice
2.5 ounces Honey
30 whole Cloves
10 Lemons
Directions:
Combine juice of ten lemons and 30 cloves in a plastic container or cake mold and freeze. Combine all ingredients in a large punch bowl. Remove flavored ice block from freezer and add to punch bowl. Serves six.
Next up is the Holiday Caribbean Bowl.
Holiday Caribbean Bowl
Ingredients:
10 oz. Appleton® Estate Reserve Blend
8 oz. Appleton® Estate Rare Blend 12 Year Old
9 oz. Sandeman Fine Rich Madeira
2 oz. Pierre Ferrand Dry Orange Curaçao
9 oz. Dave Wondrich Demerara-Orange Shrub (recipe below)
18 oz. cold filtered water
3 lemon halves squeezed in by hand and rubbed around the rim of the bowl
Directions:
Combine all ingredients in punch bowl, garnish with lemon, orange wheels and nutmeg.
Lastly is the Estate Signature Punch.
Estate Signature Punch
Ingredients:
18oz Appleton® Estate Signature Blend
2oz Benedictine
9oz Sandeman Character Amontillado Sherry
9oz Orange/Lemon Demerara Shrub (recipe below)
18oz old strong hibiscus tea
Garnish: Grated nutmeg and frozen peels and/or citrus wheels
Directions :
Combine all the ingredients into a large pitcher and add large ice cubes. Inform your guests to prepare their drinks, they should fill their glass with ice, pour in the punch, and top with the citrus garnishes and grated nutmeg.
If you've noticed, the last two recipes ask for either a Demerara-Orange Shrub or a Demerara Orange/Lemon Shrub. So as you don't get confused a Demerara Shrub is nothing more than a simple sugar syrup that is made with fruits, sugar and sometimes vinegar. Once you start making the demerara you'll run across oleo sacrum another phrase that may confuse you. Oleo sacrum is nothing more than a combination of citrus and sugar that is more of a sugary oil that provides an added flavor and aroma to your punch. For the purpose of the recipes listed above, here's how to make Demerara-Orange Shrub, Orange/Lemon Demerara and Oleo Sacrum.
David Wondrich' s Demerara-Orange Shrub
Combine in heavy plastic bowl Oleo-Saccharum made of of 6 cups Demerara sugar (6 cups sugar + peel of 12 medium oranges & 8 lemons), 3 cups boiling water and then stir until sugar has dissolved.
Once sugar has dissolved add the following:
6 cups / 48 oz. lemon juice
1-1/2 cups / 12 oz. orange juice
Stir all together again and then strain out peels. This will make about 3 1/3 quarts.
This Demerara-Orange Shrub will keep as long as refrigerated for two days.
Orange/Lemon Demerara Shrub
Makes around 25 oz
To make the Oleo Sacrum take a large mason jar and combine in it the following:
1.5 cups Demerara sugar
The peels of 3 medium oranges and 2 lemons
Muddle them all together and then shake it up. Let it sit still for three or four hours. Next, add six ounces of boiling water. Shake again until all the sugar has dissolved and then let chill. Once completed the Oleo Sacrum can be refrigerated for up to a week or longer if frozen.
To make the Orange/Lemon Demerara Shrub:
Combine 12 ounces of of lemon juice and three ounces of orange juice to the Oleo Sacrum. Stir thoroughly and strain out any peels. Pour into a bottle and store in the refrigerator until you're ready to use.
It may seem like a lot of work just to make a rum punch but it's well worth it in the long run. Your friends will love trying out something new and exciting and because you make it advance there's no reason to worry about refilling anyone's drinks all night long! To learn more about Appleton Estate Jamaican Rum visit www.appletonestate.com/ where you'll also find more cocktail recipes for all occasions and events.
